textList.name: START_BEACON_ROCK
textList.text: The Sower rarely interact with other races unless it's necessary to complete their sacred mission to prepare the universe for the return of the Endless. Let's hope they don't construe your travel here as interference.
The Sower are a robot race whose secrets remain a mystery. It is not unheard of to have a peaceful journey through their lands - but don't count on it.

There's a lot of Sower activity in this sector. Sower planets are lush paradises on which most races can easily live, but the allure of their sparkling water and clear meadows is somewhat spoiled by the imposing presence of these massive robots. Since the Sower tend to ignore other races, most don't settle here due to the risk of their planets being terraformed while they're still on it.

textList.name: STORE_ROCK
textList.text: You cross paths with a Sower vessel returning from a rare diplomatic mission. Equally surprising, they are remotely pinging your ship's inventory system.

You come across a Sower colony on a world in the early stages of terraformation. They must need Dust and raw materials from offworld; they are contacting your ship using the standard galactic communications protocol.
With the local Sower settlements unwilling to communicate with other life forms, an opportunistic Mantis crew has postponed its piratical activities and set up shop to catch any passing trade.
A fabrication system in the lifeless husk of a massive Sower capital ship is still functioning after hundreds of thousands of years. A lively interspecies market has formed around this nucleus.
You receive a hail on Pilgrim frequencies; a large Sower colony running metastrategic subroutines seemed to have decided to trade with you. You are wary, but robots are not known for being deceitful.

textList.name: NOTHING_ROCK
textList.text: You receive a message meant to degrade you as aliens. You half expect an attack but it seems to have come from a small civilian shuttle.
No one bothers your ship as you float among numerous space stations and mining platforms. The Sower certainly run efficient operations.

You arrive and detect signs of battle. A few ships are taking passes at each other near a small station. You don't know if it's a territory issue, a contest or a rite of passage but you decide it's best to stay out of it.
There's not much at this beacon. Just a few abandoned depots, stripped clean.
A few Sower logistics vessels pass by but they ignore all communications. Must not be in their programming.
You see a small trading post and hail them, but there is only silence."
You see a Sophon merchant and ask about his wares. He responds, "Sorry, but it took years to gain their trust. I can't be seen communicating with you. I hope you understand." He cuts communications.

textList.name: ROCK_SHIP
textList.text: Sower patrol ship arrives and you intercept their internal communications: "...etTarget(inSysFString.readQuadrant(5.7,64.));self.Mode=AGGRESSIVE;self+=WepArrayChargeHa..." As the code swims before your eyes, you realize that they are attacking!
You encounter a Sower vessel and attempt to open trading frequencies, but it immediately opens fire.
You jump into the middle of a Sower excavation project on a nearby moon. Unimpressed with your intrusion they move to defend themselves!
You intercept Sower interprocess communications - they are remote method calls to military subroutines! There is no talking to these guys.
It looks quiet, but you realize your computer is being scanned. A hidden Sower vessel attempts to erase certain ship log entries, but when your crew denies write access they open fire.
You notice a Sower ship performing combat exercises. However, they quickly change their course to engage your ship. They apparently treat unregistered alien ships as handy target practice.
A loud 'thud' resounds through the ship after jump completion - you've just shunted a Sower fighter and it's already preparing to fire!
You're intercepted by a Sower salvage operation. They seem intent on processing your ship as well - whether you're on it or not.

textList.name: ROCK_SHIP_SURRENDER
textList.text: The Sower vessel diverts power from weapons to their communications array and pings your ship: "... . .... . ..... .........". They must be signalling their surrender.
Their systems suffering, the Sower vessel ejects several tons of matter and diverts what little power remains to engines. They are attempting to limp away.
Shields failing and hull integrity on the ropes, the Sower vessel transmits an intergalactic standard distress signal, as well as their cargo manifest.
They seem to have given up on their attack and are standing off at a safe distance. Perhaps they're willing to trade their mineral riches for safety.

textList.name: ROCK_PIRATE
textList.text: Sower pirates are nearly unheard of, given that (everyone assumes) the Sower are merely intelligent robots. To your amazement, a Sower ship without an IFF signature blazes towards you, weapons hot.
A Sower ship flies past your windows and you recognise outcast decorations on the hull. This ship must have been captured by pirates!

A motley collection of Sower ships are stationed around this beacon, their terraforming tools powered off. Nearby, there are signs of a destroyed planet; these ships must have been here for milleneia! Programming corrupted, they advance towards you. Defensive maneuvers!

You don't know how, but a mixed Mantis and Human pirate crew has managed to capture a Sower ship and convert it for their use! Perhaps they thought the Sower ship's Endless Hull was worth the effort; let's see how it fairs against your ship's weaponry.

event.name: ROCK_LOOTING
event.text: You find a disabled Sower transport floating near the beacon. You consider stripping it of useful parts but are uncertain why it's there in the first place.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Check for lifeforms and keep a lookout for ships while looting the wreck.
Have your Sower ping the ship's diagnostic systems.

event.text: You salvage what you can from the ship. No one bothers you during the operation.
A Sower patrol ship jumps in while you are salvaging the ship. You doubt they will understand your...mitigating circumstances.
The Sower are not known for setting traps, but you hasten to leave anyway.
The Sower are not known for setting traps, but you hasten to leave anyway.

Before you have a chance to leave, a Sower patrol ship arrives and you intercept their internal communications: "...etTarget(inSysFString.readQuadrant(2,55));self.Mode=AGGRESSIVE;self+=WepArrayChargeHa..." As the code swims before your eyes, you realize that they are attacking!
You salvage what you can from the ship. No lifeforms or ships are detected nearby.
You begin the salvage operation but before long your crew warns you of an approaching ship. You hasten to leave before they get within firing range.
With your safety confirmed by your Sower crewmember, you salvage what you can from the ship.
The Sower indicates that this ship is scheduled for recycling within a few hours. Best salvage what you can and leave before that occurs.

event.name: ROCK_NURSERY
event.text: Fluctuating but regular EM fluctuations are reported near the surface of a hazy, pock-marked moon in the vicinity. It seems this is a Sower factory where genetic learning algorithms are downloaded into freshly manufactured units - only there's been some kind of error and the untrained Sower are running amok!

choice.text: Transfer an away team to investigate.

event.text: Your away team reports combat between mature and freshly made Sower - it seems some of the new ones were considered to have unmergable traits and were to be recycled.

choice.text: Order the away team to side with the new Sower.

event.text: It's not long before the violence on the planet becomes a full-scale battle, your away team and their military-grade weaponry in the very center of it.

choice.text: Order the away team to side with the establishment.

event.text: It's not long before the violence on the planet becomes a full-scale battle, your away team and their military-grade weaponry in the very center of it.
As long as they're not shooting at the ship it's best to leave them be.

choice.text: (Improved Weapons) Fire a warning shot near to the commotion to announce your arrival.

event.text: You dispatch a barrage of weapons fire that crashes home into an unused quarry near to the installation. Weapons fire on the surface ceases for as long as it takes for the moon's defense force to be dispatched to your location!
Things, in the end, do not go well. The enemy succeeds in flanking your team and they're forced to retreat to the ship.
The Sower subdue the last of the renegades; orbital materials processing facilities burn hot in anticipation of the influx.

The fight goes poorly, and your team eventually finds itself out on the flank with a wounded Sower combat unit in tow. They make a desperate push for the shuttle co-ordinates, but one falls. The survivor helps the damaged Sower aboard.
The Sower subdue the last of the renegades; orbital materials processing facilities burn hot in anticipation of the influx.
Your team hunkers down in the main quad and succeeds in holding off the enemy combatants and claiming control of the institution!
The factory-fresh Sower secure the remaining enemy units and prepare to leave the solar system with no further communication - internal strife cannot mask the fact that Sower are Sower.

Your team comes under heavy fire. One is blinded by a flash bomb and staggers past the lip of a quarry and to their death far below; the other succeeds in joining with friendly forces and ultimately claims control of the institution!
The factory-fresh Sower secure the remaining enemy units and prepare to leave the solar system with no further communication - internal strife cannot mask the fact that Sower are Sower.

As the battle proceeds the action moves away from your team's location. During the lull they're able to secure some abandoned weapons; by the time they're done the battle is largely over and they return to ship.

event.name: ROCK_NURSERY_WIN
event.text: In return for your support during the fight the survivors reward you with the factory's Dust reserves. You leave before anyone changes their mind.

event.name: ROCK_NURSERY_LOSE
event.text: Fully aware that their victory was threatened by your arrival, the survivors immediately dispatch a ship to eliminate you!

event.name: ROCK_MANTIS_HUNTER
event.text: A Mantis ship here is adorned with Sower parts! It would be a gorier display if they had internal organs, but the message is clear enough: this is a hunter of a very specialised kind.
No species deserves a Mantis hunter on their back - time to make the galaxy a little safer. Engage!
The Mantis take no interest in your ship - they're lying in wait for the next Sower ship to venture through. You're able to spin up the engines and jump at your leisure.

You smash into the aft end of the Mantis ship at flank speed, ripping it apart like a tin can. You cause irreparable damage to their systems. and your ship's armored hull is hardly dented from the impact. To your astonishment, the Mantis are still trying to fight!

choice.text: (Sower Crew) Put your Sower crew member on the comm.

event.text: The two aliens face one another over the vidscreen. "Earth-killing metal-man!" yells the furious Mantis captain. "See, I paint my ship with your companions! I paint my ship with you!" The Sower says little - being, after all, a robot - and merely powers up your weapons. Them's fighting words, apparently.

event.name: ROCK_MANTIS_FREIGHTER
event.text: A curious sight greets you at this beacon: a disabled Sower freighter drifts in space while two Mantis craft battle it out - presumably over who deserves the spoils.

choice.text: Wait, then attack the surviving Mantis.

event.text: There's quite enough action here already - prepare for light speed.

While the two Mantis fight you approach the Sower ship and send a repair drone through one of the many breaches. It fixes the ship up enough to make at least a single jump. You're surprised when, instead, it embarks on a kamikaze run towards the two Mantis, which results in the obliteration of all three!

While the two Mantis fight you approach the Sower ship and use a drone to fix up the ship. Once the breaches are fixed the shields flicker back on. In a matter of moments they are already in pursuit of one of the Mantis ships. Meanwhile the second Mantis turns toward you.

The Mantis craft are both too busy slaughtering one another to notice you. Eventually the smaller ship gets the upper hand when it overrides the enemy door system and flushes the crew into space. Now's the time!

The Mantis craft may have their differences, but when it comes to you they are of one mind. The smaller ship suffers a power failure as it moves to engage, but the larger one lets off a volley of fire and moves in to attack!

destroyed.text: In the time it took you to eliminate the Mantis ship the Sower must have repaired their FTL drive and jumped away. You pick the bones of both Mantis vessels.

deadCrew.text: In the time it took you to eliminate the Mantis ship the Sower must have repaired their FTL drive and jumped away. You pick the bones of both Mantis vessels.

event.name: ROCK_ZOLTAN_HELP
event.text: It seems a Sophon ship came here to prevent a Sower team from terraforming a planet, and that said Sower did not appreciate it. Long-range scanners suggest the Sophon and their pursuers will be here at any moment.

Sower are fine when they don't pick YOUR planet to terraform, but occasionally they must be stopped. They're robots; the Sophon can hardly be blamed for trying to turn a few off. The pursuing Sower ship quickly assesses the situation and decides two captured alien ships are better than one.
The Sophon should have known better than to interfere. They still refuse to officially recognize the Pilgrim government - let 'em roast.
This is none of your concern - power up the jump drive!

destroyed.text: The Sower ship's hull breaks apart. You salvage the wreck before contacting the Sophon ship.

event.text: The exhuberant Sophon expresses her gratitude with a small payment: Dust, and some of the finest space-cigars Sophis has to offer.

deadCrew.text: With the ship's computer dead you salvage the ship before contacting the Sophons.

event.text: You receive a transport shipment of material, and the Sophon captain hails you. "You humans intrigue me....what led you to assist us? Perplexing; requires further study. Please join me for dinner in my quarters." After several hours of mutual study, you return to your ship feeling refreshed and enlightened.

destroyed.text: The Sower ship arrives just as you put the finishing blows to the Sophon ship. They're not of a mind to thank you, and you get the impression it'd be best if you left post haste..

deadCrew.text: By the time the Sower ship arrives you've all but tied a bow around their quarry. The injured and dying Sophon are easily taken into custody and the Sower ship transfers almost an ounce of Dust. The Sophon captain shakes his head as he passes you on the way to the brig, muttering about "...death of intellectual curiousity, and such a shameful loss of scientific data on the Sower..."

event.name: ROCK_ATHIEST
event.text: You encounter a massive Sower craft with minimal propulsion; after half an hour, you are able to set up a primitive serial connection with its control center. It appears to have terminated all aspects of its terraforming mission, and is now locked in a decision loop with no exit.

choice.text: Let's play god. Attempt to insert a JUMPX instruction pointing to a procedure slaving its high-order functions to our ship's computer.
They may not be organic, but you don't feel like messing with a sentient creature's mind. Send one instruction only: "continue;". Deep.
(Improved Sensors) Grant READ access to your ship's data suite.

event.text: Within nanoseconds the Sower mainframe has accessed every scrap of information in your ship's database. After a short pause, your personal terminal goes black and displays "ISPILGRIMTRUE;ISBESTOUTCOME;PILGRIM.MISSION=SELF.PRIORITY;" You have been judged, and found worthy; this machine has decided that your cause is just. You hold back tears of pride as a Sower unit joins your crew.

textList.name: ROCK_ATHIEST_BAD
textList.text: Did you seriously just try to hack a fucking robot? Yeah. They're shooting at you now.
Apparently, the Sower use 1-based arrays. Instead of granting you control of the vessel, your little trick jumps them right into the constructor of Kick(int ass) and passes "your" as a parameter.
Your ignorance of Sower code conventions means that your little JUMPX instruction threw an exception. Sower security interceptors catch it and mark you as hostile. Documentation saves lives, people.

event.text: The Sower silently turn to jump for another system, but not before the ship ejects a mostly-functional Sower unit. You think you can fix it.
The massive, ancient Sower vessel turns and jumps for a planet in some far-away system. Majestic.
The massive, ancient Sower vessel turns and jumps for a planet in some far-away system. Majestic.

event.name: ROCK_STARSHIP_MINE
event.text: The burnt out hull of a Sower mine layer drifts by. Behind the wreck drifts a live mine; an automated drone that drills into ships' hulls before exploding. It locks onto your ship's signature and heads your way!
The ship's turning circle proves too wide and the mine bites down onto the hull. You can hear it now, chewing through the armour.

choice.text: Send someone out there to defuse it.
(Missile Weapon) Attempt a controlled detonation using a missile.

event.text: After drawing straws, a crew member goes out to fix a modified warhead to the mine. You detonate the missile in a way that dislodges the mine. It blows up shortly after. The ship takes some damage in the blasts, but you're still sailing.

choice.text: (Beam Drone) Use a drone to cut away the mine with a precision beam.

event.text: Carefully guided from the bridge, your beam drone removes the mine's grappling arms and sends it drifting off into space, where you shoot at it until it detonates at a safe distance.

choice.text: (Improved Engines) Damn the torpedoes - full speed ahead!

event.text: The acceleration throws your crew against the rear bulkhead, but your drive's bow wave knocks the mine aside before it can establish a firm grip. Your ship is rocks as the mine detonates in your wake.
Your crew-member dons a space suit and exits the airlock. They make quick work of the basic device and return inside to relief all round. The mine makes good pickings too.
Your crew-member dons a space suit and exits the airlock. When they open up the mine housing, though, they panic. The red wire or the blue?! 3... 2... 1...
You open your eyes and everything is still where it was a moment ago. You did it!

The weapon detonates. Everything goes dark, the bridge illuminated by flames pouring from the hull, your bomb disposal volunteer spinning off toward a nearby sun. You put out the fires and prepare to move on.

textList.name: ROCK_BOARDERS_SHIP
textList.text: You passively scan a small Sower station that is next to the beacon. However they must not have appreciated your curiosity. Your transporter's safety locks are disabled - a Sower combat unit beams on board!

You find a Sower ship docked with a damaged Mantis fighter. They hail you: "We will add your technological and ethnological distinctiveness to our own. Resistance is futile." Before you have a chance re-check which game you're playing, the ship moves in to attack you and you register teleporter symbols from the disabled ship. They're using Mantis tech to board you!

textList.name: ROCK_BOARDERS_ASTEROID
textList.text: You arrive in an asteroid field and immediately begin evasive maneuvers when a loud clunk reverberates through the ship. At first you think the hull has been hit, but the noise came from some Sower intruders teleporting aboard the ship!

Your shields are being taxed as the they deflect the debris from an asteroid field. As you weave your way between the rocks you happen upon a Sower stronghold. You register teleport signatures and hear clanks aboard the ship.

textList.name: ROCK_BOARDERS_SUN
textList.text: As soon as you arrive you hear the telltale sounds of a teleporter and clanks reverberating through the ship. Time to go 5-0 on Johnny 5's mechanical ass.

With their high resistance to heat, the Sower often attempt to harness the massive energy output of stars. You're not surprised to find Sower here next to this dying sun, but you are surprised when they teleport aboard!

textList.name: ROCK_FIGHT_ASTEROID
textList.text: A Sower vessel is harvesting the mineral-rich asteroids in this locality, and their scouts take your presence to be a transgression. Battle stations!

A Sower ship, taking its directives literally (like most Sower), took the most direct route to its destination... right through an asteroid field. Situation too dire to risk attack, they fire wildly as you jump in.

You see the flashes of a starship's shield repelling asteroids. As you draw closer, you see a Sower vessel - older and more scarred than any you have ever seen before. It is a combat vessel. You power up the battle systems and wonder how long they've been stuck here.

textList.name: ROCK_PIRATE_ASTEROID
textList.text: Minute fissures in the shields spark and crackle as the ship jumps into the wake of a huge asteroid. More asteroids follow, as does a lost and aggressive Sower warship.
You exit the jump surrounded by dirt and rocks. Before long a blast is deflected by your shield, but that was no asteroid... Incoming pirate!

textList.name: ROCK_PIRATE_SUN
textList.text: Unusual solar activity in this region means you need to get out, quick. The Sower nearby, impervious to the heat, move to attack your ship.
A Sower ship is silhouetted against a sun in supernova. Is it attempting to terraform an entire star!? The follies of machines and men...regardless, they charge their weapons as you approach.

event.name: ROCK_QUEST_MARRIAGE_START
event.text: To your surprise, a damaged Sower ship hails you. Your surprise deepens to amazement as a human wearing a fedora appears on screen. "I'm on a critical mission from the Academy - I need to get to Lexius IV, NOW! The future of Humanity depends on it! This ship's bought it; mind if I catch a ride?"

The human has a sealed crate bearing the United Empire seal beamed aboard. He assures you that it is just a supply crate, but it makes the hair on the back of your neck stand up. You consign it to the ship's hold.
"The future of the Pilgrims depends on us - the rest of humanity will have to make do." The human grimaces and terminates the transmission; you jump away.

event.name: ROCK_QUEST_MARRIAGE
event.text: It looks just like any other planet terraformed by the Sowers, but beneath the dense jungle, your sensors detect a vast tunnel network under the surface of Lexius IV. "It wasn't the Sower," your passenger says, "this planet was inhabited by the Endless, before they all died. I just need to make a quick delivery..."

As your ship enters into a holding orbit, a United Empire carrier jumps into the system. "Imperials...I hate these guys." Your passenger steps away from the viewscreen as you are hailed by a loyalist Admiral. "Captain," he says in a clipped accent, "this fugitive has stolen something...important. This is bigger than the Empire or your little rebellion; beam over the artifact, and we'll let you leave this system in peace." So that's what was in the crate: an artifact of the Endless.

Your passenger shakes his head. "I never would have thought a Pilgrim would betray the Endless." Before you can power up your engines, loyalist assault ships beam aboard, grab the passenger, and beam back to the carrier. They left some Dust. Best to leave before the Empire rethinks its generosity.
"So do you! I've had enough of your antiquated re-" Grinning mischeviously, your passenger terminates the conversation. "Beam that crate down, and let's get the hell out of here!"

destroyed.text: As you escape in the confusion, you ask your new crewmember why he'd risk angering the United Empire for an Endless relic. "Fortune and glory, kid," he says, "fortune and glory."

deadCrew.text: "You call this archeology?" You blow the closest loyalist ship into dust and escape the system.

event.name: ROCK_UNLOCK1
event.text: You receive a hail, audio-only. A mechanical voice - some sort of speech engine - warns of violence if your ship does not leave immediately. You have never known a Sower to understand language before; this must be a special unit.

choice.text: A Sower that speaks...interesting. Hail them.

event.text: They jump away. An ancient console in the corner turns black save for a blinking prompt; it displays a set of space coordiates. The display instructions are coming from the firmware itself.

choice.text: Time to test the script we wrote after our last encounter.

event.text: You quickly open up a serial connection and execute the script as the Sower ship jumps away. You catch a glimpse of some data - "fn -> string -> being : (con (eq?(car eInstrSet) 0x1b355) ENDLESS)))))..." It's like no Sower code you've ever seen before, but you manage to recover a set of coordinates.
After a few seconds, the Sower vessel jumps away.

event.name: ROCK_UNLOCK2
event.text: You arrive at the coordinates and sensors show you dangerously close to a star! Squinting against the blinding light, you can see a massive, dark object between you and the star. You'll have to analyze it later - the Sower ship attacks!

event.name: ROCK_UNLOCK3
event.text: Your mouth drops open in awe - you didn't think something like this was physically possible. Your ship comes out of FTL in front of a massive Dyson sphere surrounding an M-class star! The ship that had just tried to kill you is docked and already being repaired. Before you have time to close your mouth, you feel a tingling sensation as you are beamed off the ship. You materialize in a clean white room and are able to breath. There is nothing in the room but a massive Endless artifact that seems to still be active. Perhaps reacting to your presence, it begins to glow with a bright white light.

You receive a communication from your ship - immense power signatures have begun to emanate from the Dyson sphere! It seems the Sowers just needed you to activate the artifact - but why would an Endless artifact respond to a human? The implications of this are staggering. Your ship calls again - the Sower have slaved control of the ship that attacked you over to your navigational computer. Stranger and stranger.
event.unlockShip: The Sower deliver a cruiser to the hangar. The Bulwark has been unlocked!

event.text: Your crew manages to transport you back to the ship; as you turn to leave, a swarm of Sower microbots detaches from your hull. Your ship is in perfect shape, and she answers the helm wonderfully as you cruise away from the Dyson Sphere. As you prepare to jump, you think you recognize a feeling of being a part of something greater than yourself.
